showScoreExcerpt:
“It's a potent slice of twentieth-century history that, in its depiction of antisemitism and the fascist suppression of dissent, has disturbing resonances for today. If its reach occasionally exceeds its grasp, Warren Carlyle's dynamic production, which blends ugly historical incidents with assured showbiz pizzazz in an almost surreal rush of events, keeps it intensely watchable.”

Read more
